key_title: Key to the species of Cryptandra

source.author: Walsh, N.G.; Udovicic, F.
source.title: Cryptandra
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G.; Udovicic, F. (1999). Cryptandra. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves flat or with recurved or incurved margins, lower surface clearly visible
Leaves terete (or nearly so) with margins revolute and almost or completely obscuring lower surface
Perianth longer than 3 mm, or, if slightly shorter, then style covered in hairs for at least the lower third
Perianth shorter than 3 mm; style hairy only at base
Perianth (2.7–) 3–4 mm long; bracts distinctly shorter than hypanthium; decumbent, wiry shrub of near-coastal heathlands in far east
Perianth usually longer than 4 mm; bracts subequal to or exceeding hypanthium; rigid, divaricate shrubs of north-west and upper Snowy River area
Leaves sessile to subsessile; bracts acuminate; adaxial surface of bracts and stipules with coarse simple hairs; mallee areas
Leaves with petioles apparent (0.2–0.8 mm long); bracts obtuse and glabrous adaxially; stipules glabrous adaxially; upper Snowy River area
Hypanthium tube more or less glabrous
Sepals with sparse simple hairs, especially toward tips; stellate hairs very sparse or absent; rare, recorded only from Little Desert
Sepals with dense stellate hairs only, very rarely including a few simple hairs; widespread in mallee areas
